title: 2 Simple Ways to Format Text Into Code on Discord

steps.title: Open the Discord app.
steps.content: Open the Discord app. If you aren't already logged in, enter your email and password to do so now. [1] X Research source Discord is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Navigate to a server or Direct Message.
steps.content: Navigate to a server or Direct Message. Tap a server from the left panel, or tap a recent Direct Message to open it.

steps.title: Enter your text encased by ` on both sides.
steps.content: Enter your text encased by ` on both sides. You'll need to access your punctuation menu to find it. For example, your text should look like `your text here` . On iPhone or iPad, tap and hold the apostrophe key (') to access special characters. The back-tick is the first option on the left. On Android, open the special punctuation menu on the lower-left side of the keyboard to find the backtick key.

steps.title: Tap the airplane icon to send it.
steps.content: Tap the airplane icon to send it. When your message sends, the text will be in a code block. You can also censor text by placing two vertical bars (|) on each end of your text.

steps.title: Create a multi-line code block (optional).
steps.content: Create a multi-line code block (optional). If you want to create a code block that has more than one line of text, you'll just need to alter the punctuation slightly. Do the following: Encase your text in (```) on both sides. Your text should look like: ```line one line two``` . Tap the airplane icon to send it.

steps.title: Open the Discord application.
steps.content: Open the Discord application. Discord is available for Windows, Mac, and Linux. [2] X Research source You can also use Discord in your browser at https://discord.com/ .

steps.title: Navigate to a server or Direct Message.
steps.content: Navigate to a server or Direct Message. Click a server from the left panel, or click a recent Direct Message to open it. If needed, you can start a server or join a server .

steps.title: Enter your text encased by ` on both sides.
steps.content: Enter your text encased by ` on both sides. You'll need to access your punctuation menu to find it. You can find the back-tick key in the top-left corner of your keyboard. If needed, you can enable the on-screen keyboard to use it. For example, your text should look like `your text here` . To create a multi-line code block, encase your text in (```) on both sides. Your text should look like: ```line one line two``` .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter to send your message.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter to send your message. When your message sends, the text will be in a code block.

steps.title: Create colored text (optional).
steps.content: Create colored text (optional). This will only work on the desktop application. Colored text will not appear on the mobile app. Use the following format: Orange: ```arm your_text_with_underscores ``` . Red: ```diff -your text after a hyphen ``` . Blue: ```css [your text in brackets] ``` . Cyan: ```yaml your text here ``` . Green: ```diff +your text after a plus sign ``` .
